text: #EidMubarak to all those observing #EidUlFitr today! May this new season be a time of peaceful and blessed celebration for all. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EYwUfGXXkAADjLy.jpg
Eid Mubarak to everyone celebrating in the United States and around the world. Whether you are near or far from loved ones, wishing you and yours a joyous and safe celebration.

During the first two+ months of the pandemic:

Some Americans who lost poverty-wage jobs are receiving $600 a week in extra unemployment benefits. Republican response: How outrageous!

630 billionaires made $434 billion in profits. Republican response: Crickets.

Tax the rich.

Today's sobering front page. 

Zoom in. 

They were more than just a number, with family and friends who are grieving their loss. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EYyV1aBWAAE7fVW.jpg

RT @RevDrBarber Houses of worship are not essential, but true worship is: “When I was hungry, did you feed me? When I was thirsty, did you give me a drink? When I was a stranger, did you invite me in? When I was naked, did you clothe me? When I was sick and in prison, did you visit me?”

Instead of taking fact-based action, Trump blames others for his chaotic failures and erratic response; undermines scientists; and ignores Americans’ hardship. 

Our lives are at stake in this election. Vote. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EYydtzDWkAIU5PD.jpg

“I gave them your word, and the world hated them, because they do not belong to the world any more than I belong to the world. I do not ask that you take them out of the world but that you keep them from the evil one.”

John 17:14-15

The losses suffered by our American family have been staggering — every story heartbreaking in its own way. As we near 100,000 lives lost, we pray for those who have passed, their loved ones and all who are working to save lives & protect our communities. https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/05/24/us/us-coronavirus-deaths-100000.html

If Congress refuses to provide funding for state and local governments, then essential public workers will get laid off. It's that simple. https://twitter.com/GovMurphy/status/1263849849511981059 QT @GovMurphy We are NOT ASKING Washington for a bailout.

We ARE ASKING for aid to pay our police, fire, and EMS first responders. To keep our public health workers on the job for our recovery. To ensure our kids have the educators they will need come fall.

RT @marceelias It is not enough to say we need vote by mail. We need to advocate specifically for vote by mail rules that enfranchise all voters. If not, young and minority voters may be disenfranchised at a rate that could mean the difference in November.
https://www.democracydocket.com/2020/05/vbm-for-young-and-minority-voters/

To all those celebrating Eid al-Fitr in California and around the world: I wish you a joyous day to celebrate your month of fasting. Though Eid will look different this year, I hope your day is still filled with family, friends and blessings. #EidMubarak

Some companies are now providing free and low-cost internet to New Jersey families who cannot afford it due to the #COVID19 emergency. I encourage New Jerseyans to take a look at our new guide for how you can access these services. https://www.booker.senate.gov/download/05/22/2020/accessing-free-and-low-cost-internet-in-nj

President Trump wants to use COVID-19 as another excuse to roll back the regulations that keep all of us safe. That is a big, greasy baloney sandwich. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EYy6M5mXYAEeyRk.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1264588078703939586/vid/320x320/5o_chS7O1FhKA6Fe.mp4?tag=13

This weekend marked the end of holy month of #Ramadan and the beginning of Eid al-Fitr. Heidi and I are wishing all of our Muslim friends in Texas and around the world a happy Eid Mubarak. May your festivals be filled with joy and abundant blessings. #EidalFitr2020

RT @SenatorCollins PPP UPDATE: Nearly 3 out of 4 Maine small businesses have received funding through the Paycheck Protection Program according to the Census Bureau.  This lifeline for small employers supports approximately 200,000 Maine jobs.

This is exactly why I announced legislation to establish a racial and ethnic disparities task force. 

Unless the federal government provides an equitable response to communities hardest hit, these inequalities will continue to be exacerbated. 
https://twitter.com/NPRHealth/status/1263963371608526848 QT @NPRHealth Harvard Researchers Find 'Inequality On Top Of Inequality' In COVID-19 Deaths https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/05/22/861008750/harvard-researchers-find-inequality-on-top-of-inequality-in-covid-19-deaths?utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=twitter

RT @CECCgov The Chairs joined 213 other Parliamentarians to express “grave concerns” about the unilateral introduction of nat’l security legislation in #HongKong” & to say that this “flagrant breach of the Sino-British Joint Declaration cannot be tolerated.” https://www.hongkongwatch.org/all-posts/2020/5/23/patten-led-group-of-198-parliamentarians-from-23-countries-decry-flagrant-breach-of-the-sino-british-joint-declaration

We know that minority-owned businesses already face challenges in having equitable access to capital, pay higher interest rates and fees, and are less likely to be approved for loans. It is so important that these businesses be able to access PPP funding.
https://abcnews.go.com/Business/minority-owned-businesses-shut-coronavirus-loans-ongoing-push/story?id=70655015

Donald Trump is a bad president. He is a worse "doctor." In the midst of a pandemic, he has ignored the advice of scientists and physicians and has peddled unsound and dangerous medical ideas. For the health and well-being of this country, Trump must be defeated.

-Almost 40 million are jobless
-1 in 5 children are going hungry

Eid Mubarak to everyone celebrating the end of Ramadan. Jane and I wish you and your loved ones good health, joy and blessings.

Bailey and I are back to answer more kids’ questions about the coronavirus. 

(I’ll let you in on a secret: I think Bailey is starting to like getting to see your kids more than hanging out with Bruce and me.) http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EYwKjMLXkAEcCIk.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1264396349975511040/vid/480x270/Z55CWp38CWO2P785.mp4?tag=13

The U.S. will soon reach 100,000 deaths from COVID-19. That’s more than 40x the number of lives lost in the attack on Pearl Harbor.

We must remember that each death is one death too many. Every person lost is someone’s loved one, a neighbor, a friend.

I don't want #AhmaudArbery to be known for his unjust death. I want him to be known for his life.

To honor him now is to have a larger societal conviction to take action and stop such tragedies from ever happening again. https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1263948500578025472 QT @nowthisnews ‘Ahmaud was humble. He was kind … He was a good child’ — Ahmaud Arbery’s mother spoke to Rep. @AyannaPressley and Sen. @CoryBooker about her son’s life and seeking justice http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EYpdjJSX0AI6KJZ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1263924895823663109/vid/320x320/IMcKV6dnJBHCRfyy.mp4?tag=13
